thread.title: Cape soccer falls to Tech 5-4 and bounces back at Red Lion 4-0
thread.title_full: Cape soccer falls to Tech 5-4 and bounces back at Red Lion 4-0

author: newsroom@capegazette.com (Dan Cook)
title: Cape soccer falls to Tech 5-4 and bounces back at Red Lion 4-0
text:
Cape soccer falls to Tech 5-4 and bounces back at Red Lion 4-0 By Dan Cook | Oct 08, 2015 Photo by: Dan Cook Cape senior Drew Mulcahy heads the ball over Tech goalkeeper Anthony Hitchcock, but it was swept away by a hustling Ravens defender in the Sussex Tech 5-4 double overtime win over the Vikings. 
Cards were handed out by the refs at the Cape versus Sussex Tech soccer matchup Oct. 5, but they weren't the holiday type, as the Vikings dropped a 5-4 heartbreaker in double overtime. 
The high-tension rivalry had a physicality that was a test for a two-official team on each sideline. 
"It's frustrating. When you have a game of this magnitude, you really have to prioritize your reffing needs and place them where they are better suited," said Cape coach Patrick Kilby. "The game against Tech is one of those games where a three-man crew would have definitely benefited the game in general." 
The Ravens started off quickly with a goal by Marlon Trejo at the 32-minute mark. 
"Marlon's shots from distance are always dangerous," said Kilby. "We didn't implement our scouting report on them." 
Cape's Drew Mulcahy tied the game with a header goal two minutes later. 
Tech answered with goals by Michael Barr and Joshua Artiga to go into the halftime break up 3-1. 
"We've been in this situation before and came back and won the game," said Kilby of being down 2-0 against Parkside in the season opener and winning the contest 3-2. "We're definitely a team that has will and can fight back, but we can't afford to keep putting ourselves in that position." 
Cape came out in the second half with goals by Drew Mulcahy, an own goal by the Ravens and a score by Steven Matalavage to put the Vikings in the lead 4-3. 
Tech's Marlon Trejo scored his second goal of the game on a penalty kick with two minutes remaining in regulation to tie the game and send it to OT. 
A Vikings red card in the second overtime gave the Ravens an advantage in the sudden-death period. Tech's Michael Barr scored with two minutes left in the second overtime to give the Ravens the victory. 
"We've talked about not hurting ourselves with unnecessary fouls, in regard to playing without patience, these are the things that hurt us," Kilby said. 
About receiving his team's second red card in as many games, Kilby said, "Regardless of if they are being baited by the other players or being baited by the crowd, the bottom line is the team has to come first, and we can't afford a few teammates to act out and hurt the cause." 
On Oct. 6, the Vikings got back on the winning track with a 4-0 shutout of the Lions of Red Lion Christian Academy. 
"It's what we needed after the Tech game," said Kilby. "To get back on the field quickly and have a short memory of the Tech game. Everyone got to play, and the starters got some rest time." 
Drew Mulcahy and Jack Ashby each had a pair of goals. The Vikings outshot the Lions 29-5. 
Cape defender Tyler Malloy, right, controls the ball over the slide tackle attempt by a Tech's Oscar Angel-Velasquez. (Photo by: Dan Cook) Cape's center back Joao Ferreira boots the ball upfield during the Vikings' 5-4 loss to the Ravens. (Photo by: Dan Cook) Cape's Drew Mulcahy, left, celebrates his second goal of the game with teammate Zachary Gelof. (Photo by: Dan Cook) Ravens goalkeeper Anthony Hitchcock gets major air to make a save on a Cape corner kick. He made nine saves in the contest. (Photo by: Dan Cook) Cape senior Jack Ashby controls a high ball in the Vikings' 4-0 win over Red Lion. (Photo by: Dan Cook) Cape defender Tyler Malloy heads the ball away from a Lions forward. (Photo by: Dan Cook) Cape forward Drew Mulcahy drives the ball past a Lions defender. (Photo by: Dan Cook) Cape senior forward Steven Matalavage traps a high ball. (Photo by: Dan Cook) Cape's Zack Gelof moves the ball upfield. (Photo by: Dan Cook) Cape senior Jason Garcia splits two Red Lion defenders. (Photo by: Dan Cook)
